void TTEOutput::handleMessage ( cMessage *  msg  )  [protected, virtual]

Forwards the messages from the different buffers and LLC according to the TTEthernet specification.

Time-triggered messages are send immediately, rate-constrained and best-effort messages are delayed if they do not fit in the gap until the next time-triggered message. If the lower layer is idle messages are picked from the queues according to the priorities. Time-triggered buffers can free the bandwidth reservation mechanism by sending a TTBufferEmpty message.

Parameters:
msg the incoming message

Definition at line 52 of file TTEOutput.cc.

00057         ASSERT(framesRequested > 0);
00058         ASSERT(framesRequested == 1);
00059         if(ttBuffers.size()>0){
00060             ttBuffersPos = (++ttBuffersPos % ttBuffers.size());
00061         }
00062

00065         {
00066             if (framesRequested)
00067             {
00068                 framesRequested--;
00069                 requestPacket();
00070             }
00071             delete msg;
00072         }
00073         //Else send frame
00074         else
00075         {

00077             {

00085                 ttQueue.insert(msg);
00086                 emit(ttQueueLengthSignal, ttQueue.length());
00087             }
00088         }
00089     }
00090     else if (msg->arrivedOn("RCin"))

00112             {
00113                 rcQueue[priority].insert(msg);
00114             }
00115             else

00118                 ev << "Priority missing!" << endl;
00119             }
00120         }
00121     }
00122     //Frames arrived on in are best-effort frames
00123     else if (msg->arrivedOn("in"))
00124     {
00125         // If there are framesRequested the MAC layer is currently idle
00126         if (framesRequested && isTransmissionAllowed((EtherFrame*) msg))
00127         {
00128             framesRequested--;
00129             msg->addPar("sent").setLongValue(((TTEScheduler*)getParentModule()->getParentModule()->getSubmodule("tteScheduler"))->getTicks());

00131             send(msg, gateBaseId("out"));
00132         }
00133         else
00134         {
00135             beQueue.insert(msg);
00136             emit(beQueueLengthSignal, beQueue.length());
00137         }
00138     }

bool TTEOutput::isTransmissionAllowed ( EtherFrame *  message  )  [private, virtual]

Helper function to check whether a Messages is allowed to be transmitted.

The function checks whether a message fits in the gap until the next TT-message should be transmitted. It uses the message length to calculate the transmission duration.

Parameters:
message The message that should be transmitted
Returns:
true if transmission is allowed else false

Definition at line 259 of file TTEOutput.cc.

00285     }
00286     //Send Window End is in next cycle
00287     else if (scheduler->getTicks() > endTicks)
00288     {

00290     }
00291 
00292     //TODO: Perhaps more complex calculations needed?
00293     if ((scheduler->getTicks() + sendTicks) >= startTicks)
00294     {
00295         ev << "transmission not allowed!" << endl;
00296         return false;
00297     }
00298     return true;
00299 }

void TTEOutput::requestPacket (  )  [protected, virtual]

this method is invoked when the underlying mac is idle.

When this method is invoked the module sends a new message when there is one. Else it saves the state and sends the message immediately when it is received.

Definition at line 201 of file TTEOutput.cc.
